definition: geisha (Japanese female entertainer)/also written 藝伎|艺伎[yi4 ji4]

sentences.english: The gokagai of Kyoto are its five geisha districts, also known as hanamachi ("flower towns").
sentences.chinese: 京都的五花街是五大藝妓聚集區，也已花街聞名。

sentences.english: In modern Japan, geisha and maiko are now a rare sight outside hanamachi.
sentences.chinese: 日本現代，在花街之外是很難見到藝妓和舞妓的。

sentences.english: Nowadays, a geisha’s sex life is her private affair.
sentences.chinese: 如今，一個藝妓的性生活已成她的隱私。

sentences.english: At the pinnacle of the complex geisha ranking system are the grand dowagers of Kyoto.
sentences.chinese: 在複雜的藝妓等級系統的頂峯，是京都的“太夫”。

sentences.english: From his window he could hear the music of the geishas.
sentences.chinese: 窗外有藝妓奏樂的聲音。

sentences.english: Today i went to kyoto again to see geisha dance, with Noriko and Rie.
sentences.chinese: 今天和兩個日本閨蜜一起去京都看藝妓表演的舞蹈。

sentences.english: The term geisha literally translates to mean “entertainer.
sentences.chinese: “藝妓一詞從字面上翻譯是指“藝人”。

sentences.english: At the opposite end of spectrum are the hot-spring geisha.
sentences.chinese: 藝妓領域的另一個極端，是溫泉藝妓。

sentences.english: At the opposite end of spectrum are the hot-spring geisha.
sentences.chinese: 藝妓領域的另一個極端，是溫泉藝妓。

sentences.english: Maiko (literally "dance girl") are apprentice geisha, and this stage can last for years.
sentences.chinese: 舞妓是藝妓生手，這個過程可能會持續很多年。

sentences.english: The first to use gold foil is Japan's Kyoto geisha.
sentences.chinese: 最早使用金箔紙的是日本京都的藝妓。

sentences.english: A geisha once gave him a commission for a painting.
sentences.chinese: 一次，一個藝妓約請他畫畫。

sentences.english: The geisha women live in a strictly matriarchal society.Women dominate.
sentences.chinese: 藝妓生活在一個嚴格的母系社會中，婦女占主導地位。

sentences.english: I was going back to my hotel in Tokyo and I was lucky enough to see these beautiful geishas crossing the street.
sentences.chinese: 我在回酒店的途中幸運地遇到了這些美麗的日本藝妓。

sentences.english: After Japan lost the war, geisha dispersed and the profession was in shambles.
sentences.chinese: 日本戰敗後，藝妓行業分散而混亂。

sentences.english: A maiko is essentially an apprentice and is therefore bonded under a contract to her okiya.
sentences.chinese: maiko只是學徒，要和藝妓屋籤合同。

definition: to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap
